moduslam.frontend_manager.edge_factories.edge_factory_ABC module

class moduslam.frontend_manager.edge_factories.edge_factory_ABC.EdgeFactory(config: EdgeFactoryConfig)[source]

Bases: ABC, Generic[BaseEdge, BaseVertex]

Abstract factory for creating edges.

__init__(config: EdgeFactoryConfig)[source]
Parameters:

config – configuration of the factory.

property name: str

Unique name of the factory.

abstract create(graph: Graph, measurements: OrderedSet[Measurement], timestamp: int) → list[BaseEdge][source]

Creates new edges from the measurements.

Parameters:

  • graph – the graph to create edges for.

  • measurements – measurements from different handlers.

  • timestamp – the final timestamp for the edge(s).

Returns:

new edges.

class moduslam.frontend_manager.edge_factories.gps_position.GpsPositionEdgeFactory(config: EdgeFactoryConfig)[source]

Bases: EdgeFactory

Creates edges of type GpsPosition.

__init__(config: EdgeFactoryConfig)[source]
Parameters:

config – configuration of the factory.

create(graph: Graph, measurements: OrderedSet[Measurement], timestamp: int) → list[GpsPosition][source]

Creates 1 edge (GpsPosition) with the given measurement.

Parameters:

  • graph – the graph to create the edge for.

  • measurements – contains SE(3) transformation matrix.

  • timestamp – timestamp of the measurement.

Returns:

list with 1 edge.

static _create_edge(vertex: Pose, measurement: Measurement) → GpsPosition[source]

Creates the graph edge.

Parameters:

  • vertex – graph vertex to be used for the new edge.

  • measurement – measurement with [x,y,z] position.

Returns:

new edge.

Bases: EdgeFactory

Creates edges of type LidarOdometry.

__init__(config: EdgeFactoryConfig) → None[source]
Parameters:

config – configuration of the factory.

create(graph: Graph, measurements: OrderedSet[Measurement], timestamp: int) → list[LidarOdometry][source]

Creates 1 edge (LidarOdometry) with the given measurements.

Parameters:

  • graph – the graph to create the edge for.

  • measurements – contains SE(3) transformation matrix.

  • timestamp – timestamp of the j-th lidar pose.

Returns:

list with 1 edge.

static _create_factor(vertex1_id: int, vertex2_id: int, measurement: Measurement, noise_model: Variances) → BetweenFactorPose3[source]

Creates the GTSAM factor for the factor graph.

Parameters:

  • vertex1_id – id of the first vertex.

  • vertex2_id – id of the second vertex.

  • measurement – a measurement with values: transformation matrix SE(3).

  • noise_model – GTSAM noise model.

Returns:

GTSAM factor.

_create_edge(vertex1: LidarPose, vertex2: LidarPose, measurement: Measurement) → LidarOdometry[source]

Creates an edge.

Parameters:

  • vertex1 – first vertex.

  • vertex2 – second vertex.

  • measurement – a measurement with the transformation matrix SE(3).

Returns:

new edge.

static _get_vertices(storage: VertexStorage, t1: int, t2: int, time_margin: int) → tuple[LidarPose, LidarPose][source]

Gets vertices with the given timestamps.

Parameters:

  • storage – storage of vertices.

  • t1 – timestamp of the 1-st vertex.

  • t2 – timestamp of the 2-nd vertex.

  • time_margin – time margin for the search.

Returns:

2 vertices.

moduslam.frontend_manager.edge_factories.utils module

Common utility functions for edge factories.

moduslam.frontend_manager.edge_factories.utils.update_vertex(source_vertex: OptimizableVertex, target_vertex: OptimizableVertex)[source]

Updates the target vertex with the source vertex value.

Parameters:

  • source_vertex – vertex to copy the value from.

  • target_vertex – vertex to copy the value to.

moduslam.frontend_manager.edge_factories.utils.get_last_vertex(vertex_type: type[BaseVertex], storage: VertexStorage, timestamp: int, time_margin: int) → BaseVertex | None[source]

Gets the latest vertex in the storage by timestamp.

Parameters:

  • vertex_type – type of the vertex.

  • storage – storage of vertices.

  • timestamp – timestamp of the vertex.

  • time_margin – time margin for searching the closest vertex.

Returns:

vertex if found.

moduslam.frontend_manager.edge_factories.utils.get_vertex(vertex_type: type[Vertex], storage: VertexStorage, timestamp: int, time_margin: int) → Vertex[source]

Seeks for the vertex or creates a new one.

Parameters:

  • vertex_type – type of the vertex.

  • storage – storage of the vertices.

  • timestamp – timestamp of the vertex.

  • time_margin – time margin for the vertex search.

Returns:

vertex.
